intro: Mecodium contortum, commonly known as the twisted mecodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features opposite, linear leaves and produces showy, two-lipped flowers in shades of purple and blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
